1:
My son, do not forget my commands\q and keep my teachings in your heart,
\q
2:
for length of days and years of life\q and peace they will add to you.


\q
3:
Do not let covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness ever leave you,\q tie them together about your neck,
\q write them on the tablet of your heart.
\q
4:
Then you will find favor and a good reputation\q in the sight of God and man.


\q
5:
Trust in Yahweh with all your heart\q and do not lean on your own understanding;
\q
6:
in all your ways acknowledge him\q and he will make your paths straight.


\q
7:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;\q fear Yahweh and turn away from evil.
\q
8:
It will be healing to your flesh\q and refreshment for your body.


\q
9:
Honor Yahweh with your wealth\q and with the firstfruits of all your produce,
\q
10:
and your storehouses will be filled up\q and your vats will be bursting, full of new wine.


\q
11:
My son, do not despise Yahweh's instruction\q and do not hate his rebuke,
\q
12:
for Yahweh disciplines those he loves,\q as a father deals with a son who pleases him.

\q
13:
The one who finds wisdom is blessed;\q he also gets understanding.
\q
14:
What you gain from wisdom is better than what silver will give in return\q and its profit is better than gold.


\q
15:
Wisdom is more precious than jewels\q and nothing you desire can compare to her.
\q
16:
She has length of days in her right hand;\q in her left hand are riches and honor.


\q
17:
Her ways are ways of kindness\q and all her paths are peace.
\q
18:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of it,\q those who hold on to it are happy.


\q
19:
By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth,\q by understanding he established the heavens.
\q
20:
By his knowledge the depths broke open\q and the clouds dropped their dew.


\q
21:
My son, keep sound judgment and discernment,\q and do not lose sight of them.
\q
22:
They will be life to your soul\q and an adornment of favor to wear around your neck.


\q
23:
Then you will walk on your way in safety\q and your foot will not stumble;
\q
24:
when you lie down, you will not be afraid;\q when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.


\q
25:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror\q or devastation caused by the wicked, when it comes,
\q
26:
for Yahweh will be on your side\q and will keep your foot from being caught in a trap.


\q
27:
Do not withhold good from those who deserve it,\q when it is in your power to act.
\q
28:
Do not say to your neighbor,\q "Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give it,"
\q when you have the money with you.


\q
29:
Do not make a plan to harm your neighborâ€”\q the one who lives close and trusts you.
\q
30:
Do not argue with a person without a reason,\q when he has done nothing to harm you.

\q
31:
Do not envy a violent person\q or choose any of his ways.
\q
32:
For the devious person is detestable to Yahweh,\q but he brings the upright person into his confidence.


\q
33:
The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked person,\q but he blesses the home of righteous people.
\q
34:
He mocks mockers,\q but he gives his favor to humble people.


\q
35: Wise people inherit honor,\q but fools will be lifted up in their shame.
